p: Long Pine key virus (LPKV) was isolated in the United States from a pool of 50 An. crucians, and Kampung Karu virus (KPKV) was isolated from a single An. tesselatus in Malaysia [ 47]. Both viruses were cultured on C6/36 cells and cytopathic effects were observed at 7 d post-inoculation. Inoculation of BHK-21 and Vero cells with LPKV and KPKV produced neither replication nor cytopathic effects, and these viruses did not display pathology in mice [ 47]. Hemagglutination-inhibition tests for KPKV were not possible due to absence of reactive hemagglutinin. Despite being insect-specific, LPKV and KPKV reacted serologically with antibodies directed against some dual-host flaviviruses such as WNV, JEV, and Dengue virus [ 47].
